results.title: A Geometry lesson
results.creator_credit: Virgilio Sabel, Carlo Ponti and Lux Film
results.brief_description: This Italian art film traces a relationship between the shapes of nature and the modern sculpture of the Henry Moore school. The film considers the geometrical lines of nature - the shapes and lines of the human body, the structure of crystals and the spiral lines of a snail’s shell - a combination of calculation and creative impulse. Art, by dint of instinct, approaches nature’s examples, thus widening the range of our eyes and our minds. (Award: Venice)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Virgilio Sabel, Carlo Ponti and Lux Film

results.title: General principles
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram, Brian Hannant, South Australian Film Corporation and Slater Sound Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conditioning for Sport”.
Gives an insight into some of the specific exercises and conditioning techniques necessary for the athlete to achieve his best. Illustrates various sports with particular emphasis on track and field events.

results.title: Gas welding equipment
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Gas Welding”.
Part one of a series of nine short instructional films showing methods for oxyacetylene welding from setting-up procedures through flame adjustments. Shows types of welds, cutting methods and closing down procedures. Close-up viewing of the equipment and materials being worked gives the learner an operator’s perspective into the art of oxyacetylene welding.

results.title: Future shock
results.creator_credit: Metro Media Corporation and Alex Grasshoff
results.brief_description: Examines the current phenomenon of future shock, the condition which results from too much change too fast. Current technological developments are presented through interviews with scientists. The film echoes Alvin Toffler’s questioning of whether or not change is necessary, and if it is out of control.

results.title: Further glimpses of Joey
results.creator_credit: Ross McLean, ONF | NFB and Don Owen
results.brief_description: Joey, a seven-year-old abandoned by his parents, has difficulty adjusting to the routines of family life when a new home is found for him.

results.title: What's it all about
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Brian Bergin and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Claims that we must learn to accept and adapt to social change.

results.title: Three students
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Brian Bergin and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”
One of a series of films which deal with the belief that our education should not stop with formal studies at school. This film is about three adults who have undertaken adult education courses.

results.title: Designing a curriculum
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Brian Bergin and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Courses are designed to allow students to develop a balanced background in subject undertaken so that they can think creatively and flexibly about work.

results.title: Community centres
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Brian Bergin and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the belief that our education should not stop with formal studies at school. Further education centres are located in major centres throughout South Australia. Shows some of the activities undertaken at Victor Harbour.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Explains how and why sources are allocated for adult education in South Australia.
